programme.desc: Oftentimes climate change and pollution can seem like unfathomably difficult problems to solve. Out host’s goal is to calm those fears by inviting the audience along with her as she strives to learn how to take action against the problems plaguing our planet. programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Dark Secrets" - A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Destination" - A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Toxic Forces" - Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Derailed" - A train passenger behaves oddly en route to Arizona and then disappears. The next day his bloodied body is found in Texas. Dr. G attempts to piece together this bizarre tragedy.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Broken Lives" - Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Life Interrupted" - During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Journey" - Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Speeds" - Motor vehicle fatalities account for many of the cases that come into the morgue. Dr. G offers expertise as to how to get behind the wheel and not wind up on a steel table.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Flaw" - Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Dive" - A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body - but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected, he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind - tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful - he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: HuntStand Media S1:E1 "On Top Of The World - A Rocky Mountain Bighorn Sheep Hunt (Part 2)"
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke, a lifelong big game hunter, never imagined he would ever get the chance to hunt Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. But then he found a way. Watch his hunt of a lifetime unfold in the second part of this HuntStand Original Film.

programme.title: Backwoods Bucks S2:E7 "Opening Week Big Georgia Buck"
programme.desc: Mike Lee Sr. is deer hunting in Georgia on opening week of rifle season when a BIG BUCK walks out into the Antler King food plot he is hunting on from his Rednceck Blind. Can he fill that first tag of the season?

programme.title: Backwoods Bucks S2:E8 "Buzzards Attach and Bucks Get Away"
programme.desc: Michael and the crew are in Georgia hutning when Buzzards Attack and Bucks Get Away! That's right buzzards and bucks, you've gotta watch to see how this one unfolds!

programme.title: Backwoods Bucks S2:E10 "Texas Rifle Season Kickoff"

programme.title: Road Trips S1:E8 "Breaking the Kentucky Curse | A Bluegrass Bow Buck Double"

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail S10:E9 "1091 Days" HUGE Saskatchewan Typical
programme.desc: After not notching a tag in nearly three years, this year Dean shows us why. Heading out after the buck they simply just call "The Big Typical" With his Excalibur crossbow.

programme.title: Adding a Tunnel Ram to a 408 Windsor
programme.desc: Ford’s Windsor powerplant becomes the second engine for our mobile chassis dyno. Plus: we visit this year’s PRI event in Indianapolis.

programme.title: Installing an Old School Blower on a Small Block 383 Stroker
programme.desc: The crew from Carcass needs plenty of power to move their 1-ton military truck. Our answer: supercharge a 383 ci V8!

programme.title: Prep for Success
programme.desc: The first steps you take in building any engine can lay the foundation for a reliable powerplant that lives up to its potential.

programme.title: Rebuilding 6.4 Gen III HEMI for Bigger Performance
programme.desc: Starting with a bare block, we build a piece of big modern Mopar muscle! Complete with a Holley High-Ram Intake and Terminator X Max Fuel Injection, we get a big jump in power that’s dyno proven!

programme.title: Backyard Engine Build
programme.desc: Out of the shop and into the yard! We take a weekend to rebuild a 350ci small block Chevy V8 engine like you would at your home. We’ll trade in our professional gear for tools you might have at your house to show you how to get the most out of your build.

programme.title: Winning at the Track with the 3000HP Diesel Master
programme.desc: Diesel truck drag racer Lavon Miller has been pushing the boundaries at the strip. He’s in our shop with all the race winning insight used for his record-breaking season. Plus, solving a thrown code on a 2006 Dodge Ram 1500.

programme.title: A Fine Inline Six
programme.desc: Even after 45 years, our antique Ford engine still runs. And after some needed upgrades, it will run like a champ!

programme.title: Scavenged Small Block Ford
programme.desc: We took a mysterious engine that was hidden away in our shop and filled it with whatever parts we could find lying around. Here’s what happened!

programme.title: Strokers
programme.desc: There’s no replacement for displacement! We stroke some of our favorite engines, looking for all the horsepower we can find.

programme.title: Well-Tuned Wrangler
programme.desc: The tuner aftermarket for Jeeps is thriving! A supercharged JK makes some impressive power gains on the dyno, thanks to HP Tuners.

programme.title: Honda Powered
programme.desc: We find a parked Honda Civic and try to get it back on the road. Then take it to the shop and start planning what to build.

programme.title: The Civic Rally Ripper Gets Safety & Seat Upgrades
programme.desc: Our '96 Honda Civic Rally car gets some racing seats for comfort and a rally cage for added safety.

programme.title: Adding More Power to the Rally Car’s 4 Cylinder
programme.desc: We do a little wrenching on our Honda 4 cylinder. Updating some key components and sealing up some oil leaks. Plus, the Civic gets a facelift with a Rally Car inspired paint job.

programme.title: Time to Boost and Tune ’96 Honda Rally Ripper
programme.desc: We add some major power to our 1.6 liter Honda Civic Rally Car. Then put on the dyno for some professional tuning to give us all the power we need to hit the course.

programme.title: Beetle to BajAwesome
programme.desc: What do you get when you combine a Bug and a UTV? The answer: BajAwesome. The Carcass team builds a baja style bug with a left for dead VW Beetle and a stock Can-Am Maverick X3. This is part 1 of a 3 part BajAwesome build.

programme.title: Baja Makeover
programme.desc: The Carcass duo adds a custom fit roll cage, fabricated louvers out back, and a whole bunch of style points to this baja style bug. This is part 2 of 3 of the BajAwesome build.

programme.title: Retro Baja Bug

programme.title: Kellen Erskine - Composed
programme.desc: Kellen Erskine was featured on season 7 of NBC's America's Got Talent. His jokes have appeared in many publications including the Reader's Digest. Kellen has been a finalist of both the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and the Great American Comedy Festival. This year he performed at the prestigious Bridgetown Comedy Festival in Portland, Oregon. Kellen opens regularly for Frank Caliendo of FOX's NFL Sunday.

programme.title: Aaron Woodull - Unknown
programme.desc: Adored by girlfriends' mothers everywhere, Aaron Woodall is a nice, young man coming to grips with a dirty, cynical world. Whether it be the lack of car horns for polite people, or the horrors of childbirth, or the disappointing reality of true love, Aaron always shares his disillusions with a sense of with wide-eyed excitement.His unique perspective has been entertaining sold-out comedy clubs and half-empty bars across the West for the last four years. In 2015, Aaron made his national television debut when he performed on "Laughs" on FOX, and this year he can be seen hosting the new hidden camera pranks show "Random Acts" on BYUtv.

programme.title: Jeff Allen - I Can Laugh About it Now
programme.desc: Jeff Allen combines clean, hilarious humor like no other comedian working today. Besides performing at corporate functions and fundraisers, he regularly appears on television, radio, and casinos across the country. Consistently making heroes out of meeting planners, Jeff Allen provides world-class comedy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Corey Rodrigues - People Whisperer
programme.desc: Corey is a highly sought after national touring college, club and corporate and cruise ship performer. He was the winner of The Catch a New Rising Star, The Funniest Comic in New England and the 2017 Big Sky Comedy Festivals. Rodrigues has been featured on the hilarious Gotham Live, Laughs on Fox and True Tv's Laff Mobbs Laff Tracks television shows and currently can be heard on Sirius XM. He combines comedy from his own life and the lives of those around him. Mix that with a hilarious point of view and he's able to talk about just about anything.

programme.title: Lamont Ferguson - You Had All Day
programme.desc: Ferguson has appeared on the Tonight Show, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed and ABCís Family Channel. He was the Winner of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Three time semi-finalist at the Boston Comedy Festival, Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and named ëBest of Festî at the Detroit, Lucky Eagle and San Luis Obispo Comedy Festivals. He has the distinction of being one of the only comics in the country that has opened for all of the following comedians: Steve Harvey, George Lopez, Larry Miller, Garry Shandling, Richard Jeni, and George Carlin.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Tyler Boeh - Wait For It
programme.desc: Who goes from being a mild-mannered nationally recognized college a Capella group vocal percussionist to becoming a high-energy, intelligent, physical, and downright silly beatboxing comedian? None other than Comedian Tyler Boeh, who shifted his focus from singing a Capella (a word he describes as Latin for “Without Girlfriend”) when he won a comedy contest in Portland Oregon. After winning and placing in the finals of numerous Comedy Competitions from San Francisco to Seattle to Boston to The World Series of Comedy, Boeh not only launched a great career in comedy including television appearances, colleges, cruise ships and headlining clubs, he also found a girlfriend. Tyler’s comedy CD was chosen by LaughSpin Magazine as the Best Comedy Album of 2012 and you may have seen him on such shows as Celebrity Name Game, Moms Rule, Nesn Comedy All Stars, or heard him on SIRIUS radio. Don’t miss a chance to see Tyler live.
